intro: Grypocarpha, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plants typically have hairy stems and alternate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Grypocarpha species are native to various regions in Africa and are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. They are often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
